tawakkul: And whoever relies upon Allah – then He is sufficient for him. (Quran 65:3)
Put your trust in Allah; certainly, Allah loves those who put their trust in Him. (Quran 3:159)
If you were to rely upon Allah with reliance He is due, He would provide for you just as He provides for the birds. (Tirmidhi 2344)
repentance: Indeed, Allah loves those who are constantly repentant and loves those who purify themselves. (Quran 2:222)
O My servants who have transgressed against themselves, do not despair of the mercy of Allah. (Quran 39:53)
The one who repents from sin is like one who did not sin. (Ibn Majah 4250)
hope: And never give up hope of Allah's mercy. Certainly no one despairs of Allah's mercy except the disbelieving people. (Quran 12:87)
I am as My servant thinks I am, and I am with him when he remembers Me. (Bukhari 7405, Muslim 2675)
Say: O My slaves who have transgressed against themselves, do not despair of the mercy of Allah. (Quran 39:53)
forgiveness: Indeed, Allah is ever Pardoning and Forgiving. (Quran 4:99)
Whoever pardons and makes reconciliation - his reward is from Allah. (Quran 42:40)
Be merciful to others and you will receive mercy. (Tirmidhi 1924)
humility: And do not walk upon the earth arrogantly. Indeed, you will never tear the earth [apart], and you will never reach the mountains in height. (Quran 17:37)
Whoever humbles himself for the sake of Allah, Allah will raise him in status. (Muslim 2588)
Indeed, the most honorable of you in the sight of Allah is the most righteous of you. (Quran 49:13)
generosity: The example of those who spend their wealth in the way of Allah is like a seed [of grain]... (Quran 2:261)
The believer’s shade on the Day of Resurrection will be his charity. (Tirmidhi 604)
justice: Indeed, Allah commands justice, good conduct, and giving to relatives. (Quran 16:90)
Be persistently standing firm in justice, witnesses for Allah, even if it be against yourselves. (Quran 4:135)
Verily, the most beloved of people to Allah on the Day of Judgment and the closest to Him will be the just leader. (Tirmidhi 1329)
love: And of His signs is that He created for you from yourselves mates that you may find tranquility in them; and He placed between you affection and mercy. (Quran 30:21)
The most complete of the believers in faith are those with the best character, and the best of you are those who are best to their wives. (Tirmidhi 1162)
None of you truly believes until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself. (Bukhari 13, Muslim 45)
friendship: Close friends, that Day, will be enemies to each other, except for the righteous. (Quran 43:67)
A person is upon the religion of his close friend, so beware whom you befriend. (Tirmidhi 2378)
The example of a good companion and a bad one is like a seller of musk and a blacksmith. (Bukhari 2101)
happiness: Unquestionably, by the remembrance of Allah hearts are assured. (Quran 13:28)
Whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer — We will surely cause him to live a good life. (Quran 16:97)
True enrichment does not come through possessing a lot of wealth, but true enrichment is the contentment of the soul. (Bukhari 6446, Muslim 1051)
positivity: Do not lose hope, nor be sad. You will surely be victorious if you are true believers. (Quran 3:139)
Amazing is the affair of the believer, for there is good in every matter of his. (Muslim 2999)
So verily, with the hardship, there is relief. (Quran 94:6)
determination: So when you have decided, then rely upon Allah. Indeed, Allah loves those who rely [upon Him]. (Quran 3:159)
The strong believer is more beloved to Allah than the weak believer, while there is good in both. (Muslim 2664)
And those who strive for Us – We will surely guide them to Our ways. (Quran 29:69)
motivation: So whoever does an atom's weight of good will see it. (Quran 99:7)
Be steadfast and patient, for Allah is with the patient. (Quran 8:46)
The most beloved deeds to Allah are those that are most consistent, even if small. (Bukhari 6464)
inspiration: Indeed, this Qur’an guides to that which is most upright. (Quran 17:9)
Whoever walks a path in search of knowledge, Allah will ease a path for him to Paradise. (Muslim 2699)
And say: My Lord, increase me in knowledge. (Quran 20:114)
wisdom: He gives wisdom to whom He wills, and whoever has been given wisdom has certainly been given much good. (Quran 2:269)
When the Messenger of Allah spoke, he spoke clearly and concisely. (Bukhari 3568)
O you who have believed, fear Allah and speak words of appropriate justice. (Quran 33:70)
courage: But they plan, and Allah plans. And Allah is the best of planners. (Quran 8:30)
Do not fear them; fear Me, if you are believers. (Quran 3:175)
You must be truthful, for truthfulness leads to righteousness. (Muslim 2607)
gratitude: If you are grateful, I will surely increase you [in favor]. (Quran 14:7)
Whoever is not grateful to people is not grateful to Allah. (Tirmidhi 1954)
Eat of the good things which We have provided for you, and be grateful to Allah. (Quran 2:172)
kindness: Whoever is not merciful to others will not be treated mercifully. (Bukhari 6013)
Allah is kind and loves kindness in all matters. (Bukhari 6927, Muslim 2165)
change: Indeed, Allah will not change the condition of a people until they change what is in themselves. (Quran 13:11)
Every innovation is misguidance, and every misguidance is in the Hellfire. (Muslim 867)
Renew your faith. It was said: O Messenger of Allah, how do we renew our faith? He said: Frequently say: La ilaha illallah. (Musnad Ahmad)
life: Every soul will taste death. And you will only be given your [full] compensation on the Day of Resurrection. (Quran 3:185)
This worldly life is nothing but amusement and diversion; the Hereafter is better for those who fear Allah. (Quran 6:32)
Live in this world as if you were a stranger or a traveler. (Bukhari 6416)
health: Ask Allah for forgiveness and health, for no one is given anything better after certainty than health. (Tirmidhi 3557)
There is no disease that Allah has created, except that He also has created its treatment. (Bukhari 5678)
Do not throw yourselves with your own hands into destruction. (Quran 2:195)
family: And We have enjoined upon man [care] for his parents. (Quran 29:8)
The best of you is the best to his family, and I am the best among you to my family. (Tirmidhi 3895)
Your Lord has decreed that you worship none but Him, and that you be kind to parents. (Quran 17:23)
education: Read in the name of your Lord who created. (Quran 96:1)
Seeking knowledge is an obligation upon every Muslim. (Ibn Majah 224)
Allah will raise those who have believed among you and those who were given knowledge, by degrees. (Quran 58:11)
success: Indeed, the most noble of you in the sight of Allah is the most righteous of you. (Quran 49:13)
Whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger has certainly attained a great attainment. (Quran 33:71)
Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds — they will have the Gardens of Paradise. (Quran 18:107)
patience: Indeed, Allah is with those who are patient. (Quran 2:153)
So be patient. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. (Quran 30:60)
No fatigue, nor disease, nor sorrow afflicts a Muslim, but Allah expiates some of his sins because of it. (Bukhari 5641)
faith: Indeed, those who have said, 'Our Lord is Allah' and then remained steadfast – the angels will descend upon them... (Quran 41:30)
Faith consists of more than sixty branches, and modesty is a branch of faith. (Bukhari 9, Muslim 35)
None of you will enter Paradise until you believe, and none of you will truly believe until you love one another. (Muslim 54)
